channel.title: Adding global objects
channel.description:
Can someone please tell me how/gimme a link to adding global objects? I need to know, and a lot of people ask, and so I'll be able to tell them.
PLEASE

item.title: Adding global objects
item.dc:creator: @ebaums_world ebaums world
item.description:
@ebaums_world wrote:

[quote=“kepoly, post:4, topic:124426”]AddGlobalObject(3216, 3423, 411, 0, 10);//prayer
RIGHT HERE
}

make sure its not maKE ITS ADD[/quote]

That is wrong. It is different for people. My friend uses Add, I use Make. So you need to learn what you are talking about before you post in peoples’ threads, if Add isnt working, use make.

If you need further help Taylor, PM me.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding global objects
item.dc:creator: @cody123 cody123
item.description:
@cody123 wrote:

Do this.

Go to your client and Search for

addglobalobject

Then go in there and it should look something like this

public void NewObjects() { AddGlobalObject(3004, 3383, 2469, 0, 10);//portal AddGlobalObject(2755, 3517, 2513, -2, 10);//range target AddGlobalObject(2754, 3517, 2513, -2, 10);//range target AddGlobalObject(2753, 3517, 2513, -2, 10);//range target AddGlobalObject(3252, 3439, 2513, -2, 10);//range target AddGlobalObject(2752, 3512, 381, 0, 10);//bookcase AddGlobalObject(2752, 3511, 381, 0, 10);//bookcase AddGlobalObject(3257, 3433, 381, -2, 10);//bookcase AddGlobalObject(2750, 3504, 299, 0, 10);//haybale AddGlobalObject(2752, 3504, 299, 0, 10);//haybale AddGlobalObject(2751, 3509, 1531, 1, 0);//door AddGlobalObject(2750, 3509, 1531, 1, 0);//door AddGlobalObject(2606, 3163, 5162, -3, 10); // Fighter Torso Minigame AddGlobalObject(2911, 3614, 4090, -3, 10);//flaming fire alter AddGlobalObject(2911, 3611, 2469, 0, 10);//portal AddGlobalObject(2913, 3609, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2909, 3612, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2917, 3607, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2904, 3615, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2915, 3615, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2920, 3612, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2908, 3608, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2902, 3600, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2911, 3604, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob AddGlobalObject(2909, 3612, 2153, 0, 10);//fire ob }
Then at the bottom of the list just add this

addglobalobject(xcord, ycord, object id, n/e/s/w, 10);//object name

Now just save and Exit and it should work =)

Read full topic

item.title: Adding global objects
item.dc:creator: @Taylor_John0 Taylor John0
item.description:
@Taylor_John0 wrote:

All the guides where deleted

Where do I add that?

[code]public void makeGlobalObject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType){ //Makes Global objects
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){
if(p != null){
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”)){
if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){
person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);
}
}
}
}
}
public void NewObjects() { // Pk4r Pk4r ( non laggy !)

makeGlobalObject(3216, 3423, 411, 0, 10);//prayer
}[/code]
That’s what I’ve got.

Read full topic
